data.title: Winter Trial won by father - and - daughter crew
data.text:
RACING DRIVER Shirley van der Lof and her father Alexander took top honours in the 2017 Winter Trial, which finished on 27 January in the Austrian town of St Wolfgang. The son and granddaughter of the Dutch racer Dries van der Lof were flagged away from Château St Gerlach in the Netherlands five days earlier, and diced with a strong field on a route that crossed Germany and the Czech Republic. Their 1973 BMW 3.0 CSL Alpina, like all the other entries, was tested by temperatures that dropped to -15ºC. The cold did at least keep the snow crisp, but there were numerous pirouettes nonetheless… In the Club class, the 2CV of Joost Bolwidt and Niko Bloemendal, entered only days before the event after the pair won a competition to join the…
